titleInfo.title: USA v. Abdullah et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER granting 17 Motion to Continue trial; Trial is scheduled for July 5, 2005 before Chief Judge Joseph F. Bataillon and a jury; the time betweeen April 18, 2005 and July 5, 2005 shall be deemed excludable time for purposes of speedy trial computation as to Ali Abdullah (1). Signed by Magistrate Judge Thomas D. Thalken on 4/18/2005. (MKR, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Abdullah et al
titleInfo.subTitle: JUDGMENT as to Kadhim Abdullah (2): Defendant pleaded guilty to Count I of the Indictment and is committed to the custody of the Bureau of Prisons for a term of 84 months; 5 years supervised release with special conditions; $100 special assessment, as to defendant Kadhim Abdullah. Signed by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon on 10/7/2005. 4 certified copies USM (JAE, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Abdullah et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER - The government has filed a motion pursuant to Federal Rule of Criminal Procedure 35(b). Filing No. 59; Counsel for the government shall notify the court when the motion pursuant toRule 35(b) is ripe for decision. The motion shall not be decided until counsel for thegovernment certifies that the motion is ripe.Counsel for the defendant, if previously appointed pursuant to the CriminalJustice Act, is reappointed to represent the defendant for purposes of the Rule 35(b)motion. If retained, counsel for the defendant remains as counsel for the defendant untilthe Rule 35(b) motion is resolved or until given leave to withdraw as to defendant Ali Abdullah. Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (TJS)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Abdullah et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER - IT IS ORDERED: A final dispositional hearing will be held before Judge Joseph F. Bataillon in Courtroom No. 3, Third Floor, Roman L. Hruska U.S. Courthouse, 111 South 18th Plaza, Omaha, Nebraska, at 2:00 p.m. on February 2, 2012. Defendant must be present in person. Defendant Ali Abdullah is committed to the custody of the Attorney General or his designated representative for confinement in a correctional facility. Defendant shall be afforded a reasonable opportunity for private consultation with defense counsel. Upon order of a United States court or upon request of an attorney for the government, the person in charge of the corrections facility shall deliver defendant to the United States Marshal for the purpose of an appearance in connection with a court proceeding as to defendant Ali Abdullah. Ordered by Magistrate Judge Thomas D. Thalken. (TCL )

Defendant Ali Abdullah is committed to the custody of the Attorney General or his designated representative for confinement in a correctional facility. Defendant shall be afforded a reasonable opportunity for private consultation with defense counsel. Upon order of a United States court or upon request of an attorney for the government, the person in charge of the corrections facility shall deliver defendant to the United States Marshal for the purpose of an appearance in connection with a court proceeding as to defendant Ali Abdullah.
